column2: 026 in 2019) is a town and municipality in the western Netherlands
column3: in the province of South Holland. The municipality covers an area of 14.01 km2 (5.41 sq mi) of which 1.17 km2 (0.45 sq mi) is covered by water.

column1: The first IKEA store in the Netherlands opened in Sliedrecht in 1978
column2: but it closed in 2006. Sliedrecht is also the site of the Nationaal Baggermuseum (National Dredging Museum) - featuring dredging and salvage.

column1: Dutch topographic map of the municipality of Sliedrecht
Sliedrecht railway station and Sliedrecht Baanhoek railway station are situated on the Geldermalsen–Dordrecht railway.
